API Reference

Grad Cafe Web Scraper - Module 2 Assignment

Scrapes applicant admission data from The Grad Cafe survey pages. Uses urllib3 for HTTP requests and BeautifulSoup for HTML parsing.

Notes: - This module focuses on scraping and basic parsing. - Data cleaning and persistence should live in clean.py (imported below).

scripts.scrape.save_scraped_data(entries: List[Dict[str, Any]], filepath: str = 'applicant_data.json') → None[source]

Save scraped data to a JSON file.

Parameters:

  • entries (List[Dict[str, Any]]) – Scraped entries.

  • filepath (str) – Output file path.

scripts.scrape.scrape_data(max_entries: int = 50000) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]

Pull data from Grad Cafe survey pages.

Paginates through results until max_entries is reached or no more rows exist.

Parameters:

max_entries (int) – Maximum number of entries to scrape.

Returns:

List of scraped applicant entry dictionaries.

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Any]]

scripts.scrape.scrape_new_data(existing_urls, max_entries: int = 5000, max_pages: int = 50, latest_date: str | None = None) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]

Scrape only new entries (by URL) and stop when a page yields no new results.

Parameters:

  • existing_urls – set of URLs already in the database

  • max_entries – cap on new entries to return

  • max_pages – cap on pages to scan

Returns:

List of new entry dicts

Grad Cafe Data Cleaning - Module 2 Assignment Cleans scraped applicant data: removes HTML, normalizes values, structures output. LLM-based program/university standardization is done via llm_hosting (run separately).

scripts.clean.clean_data(entries)[source]

Convert raw scraped data into a structured, cleaned format.

Cleaning performed:

  • HTML stripping for all string fields (via _normalize_value)

  • unavailable values normalized to None

  • additional cleanup for specific text fields (program/comments)

Parameters:

entries – list of dicts (raw scraped entries)

Returns:

list of cleaned dicts with consistent keys and normalized values

scripts.clean.load_data(filepath='applicant_data.json')[source]

Load data from a JSON file.

Returns:

Parsed JSON object (usually a list of dict entries).

scripts.clean.save_data(entries, filepath='applicant_data.json')[source]

Save cleaned data to a JSON file.

Notes

  • None values are serialized as the string “none” (via _replace_none_with_string).

  • ensure_ascii=False preserves non-ASCII characters.

Load corrected application data into the admission_results table.

load_data.load_corrected_data(filepath: str = 'corrected_application_data_v2.json', conn=None) → int[source]

Load the corrected Grad Cafe data JSON file into the database.

Parameters:

  • filepath – Path to the corrected JSON file.

  • conn – Optional existing psycopg connection; when omitted a new one is created.

Returns:

Number of rows inserted.

SQL queries and CLI output for Module 3 analytics.

query_data.get_db_connection()[source]

Create a new database connection.

query_data.query_scalar(cur, sql, params=None)[source]

Run a query that returns a single scalar value.

Flask app for Grad Cafe analytics and data refresh.

run.analysis()[source]

Render the analytics dashboard.

run.create_app(test_config=None)[source]

Create and configure the Flask app.

run.get_analysis_data()[source]

Return all dashboard answers as a dict.

run.get_db_connection()[source]

Create a new database connection.

Prefers DATABASE_URL if set; otherwise falls back to local defaults.

run.index()[source]

Redirect root to analysis page.

run.pull_data()[source]

Start a scrape job if one is not already running.

run.query_scalar(cur, sql, params=None)[source]

Run a query that returns a single scalar value.

run.update_analysis()[source]

Refresh analysis when no scrape job is running.
